prompt: <description>Part 1: A long, thin, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered end Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered end. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Next, create the 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system with the following details: * The sketch consists of a single face (face_1). * face_1 contains one loop (loop_1). * loop_1 is formed by four connecting lines, each connected end-to-end: * line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.0285, 0.0] * line_2: [0.0285, 0.0] to [0.0285, 0.0285] * line_3: [0.0285, 0.0285] to [0.0, 0.0285] * line_4: [0.0, 0.0285] to [0.0, 0.0] After the 2D sketch is complete, scale it using the scaling parameter, sketch\\_scale: 0.0285. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] With the 3D Sketch ready, extrude it along the Z-axis to get a 3D model with the following parameters: * extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.75 * extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 As for the final dimensions: * length: 0.0285 * width: 0.75 * height: 0.0285 (same as length due to the taper) With this, part 1 is complete, which forms the base part for further parts to build upon. The subsequent parts will involve adding more complex features to this base.</description>

Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of one face (face_1) with a single loop (loop_1). Loop_1 is formed by six line segments. 1. Line_4: Start Point [0.75, 0.375], End Point [0.1668, 0.375] 5. Line_5: Start Point [0.1668, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.2893] 6. Line_6: Start Point [0.0, 0.2893], End Point [0.0, 0.1504] Now, scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch_scale of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.0937 and no extrusion in the opposite direction. The resulting shape will be a rectangular prism with dimensions 0.75 L x 0.0938 W x 0.0938 H. This completes part_1 of the CAD assembly. Final Shape: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom For the final shape, the same coordinate system, sketch, and extrusion parameters apply as for the intermediate parts. The overall dimensions of the prism are 2 L x 4 W x 6 H. Please create the final shape with the given dimensions and note that the sides are parallel, and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides.</description>
